text: Bjurström or Bjurstrøm is a Nordic surname. Bjurström is the Swedish spelling, and Bjurstrøm is the Norwegian and Danish spelling. ==Meaning== Bjurström is an ornamental or topographic name, derived from bjur (meaning beaver) and ström (meaning river). ==Prevalence== This surname is most prevalent in Sweden, followed by the United States and Norway. ==Notable people== Notable people with this surname include: * Augusta Bjurström, founder of the Hammarstedtska skolan * Hanne Bjurstrøm (born 1960), Norwegian politician * Jonas Bjurström (born 1979), Swedish footballer * Mait Bjurström (born 1963), Swedish curler * Marco Bjurström (born 1966), Finnish dancer * Rune Bjurström (1912-1996), Swedish racewalker * Christofer Bjurström (?-alive), French/Swedish musician, composer ==References==
title: Bjurström
